Led class overhaul (see commit detail)

- `on` always turns an Led "on", whether digital or analog
- `off` always turns an Led "off", whether digital or analog
- `pulse`, `fade`, `strobe` can be _stopped_ (ie. the interval is terminated) with `stop`
- `pulse`, `fade`, `strobe` can be _turned_ _off_ (ie. the interval continues, but the Led appears "off") with `off`
- `pulse`, `fade`, `strobe` can be _turned_ _on_ (ie. the interval continues, the Led is either "on" or "off", based on the operation) with `on`
- multiple calls to the same method do not pile up
- unnecessary dependencies on instance methods are removed in favor of direct calls.

Adds HT16K33 I2C Matrix support to LedControl

* Refactored LedControl to move methods into Devices interfaces.
* Added a new device interface to support HT16K33 matrices based on port of AdaFruit I2C LED Backpack library.
* Added tests for the new device

The following options have been added to the Led.Matrix constructor to support the new device:

_isBicolor_ (default = false) If set to true the _led_ function will use the state param to set the color e.g. 0 = off,  on = any value from LedControl.COLORS and the led will be set to that color. The existing behaviour of 0 = off, 1 = on still applies for monochrome matrixes

_addresses_ optional array of I2C addresses for devices e.g. [0x70, 0x71, 0x77]
If addresses is not specified, the default addresses start at 0x70 and increment from there up to the total number of devices (specified by the _devices_ option, as per the original code for MAX7219 matrices). e.g. if neither _devices_ nor _addresses_ are specified, the default will be a single matrix with address 0x70.

The new interface is confirmed to work with OCROBOT and AdaFruit bicolor as well as AdaFruit monochrome HT16K33 matrix.

Arduino/Firmata notes: The Firmata protocol is limited to 32 bytes received from an i2c peripheralwhich should be enough, except that Firmata actually uses two of those bytes. Other platforms: should work just fine, unless those platforms have restrictions on the number of i2c rx bytes

Serial: throttle serial list attempts, add forced exit

When listing available serial connections, a maximum number of 10
attempts every 400 milliseconds are allowed, then the `board.fail`
method is called.
When disconnecting on SIGINT, add a 1000 millisecond timeout before
forcing the exit. This has been added because if one disconnects a
succesfully connected board the process could never exit on SIGINT.

Repl: fix multi board disconnection

When connecting multiple boards, an exception is thrown when exiting the
process
because `state.board.io.pending` is not defined. This commit fixes the
problem by checking the `length` property of `state.board` and looping
through the board list to check the `board.io.pending` property.
Futhermore, it add a timeout of 1000 milliseconds to force the process
exit in case the `board.io.pending` property never becomes `false` (it
has happened disconnetting a succesfully connected board).

Boards: expose `fail` event from board items

Since `board.fail` is called when connection fails, it might be useful
to echo the event in the Boards class.
